page.title: 18TRANSPORT IN PANTON
page.content: Transport in {PANTON}is very poor. The only public transport is that which is provided for the children to go to school either in Louth or East Barkwith. A school bus arrives every morning at just after eight o'clock at Warren House and collects the local children for Louth. The bus is a 53 seater bus owned by Appleby's. It picks up a full load of children on its journey to Louth which takes about 45 minutes. For the younger children a local private taxi calls at various points to collect the four children who attend East Barkwith Primary school. There is no other form of public transport and residents are wholly reliant on their own cars or bicycles.
